thread.title: Yale University subcontractor from Oregon dies in fall inside campus smokestack
thread.title_full: Yale University subcontractor from Oregon dies in fall inside campus smokestack | NOLA.com

author: Associated Press
title: Yale University subcontractor from Oregon dies in fall inside campus smokestack
text:
NEW HAVEN, Conn. â€” A man working inside a smokestack on the Yale University campus died Saturday after he fell from a ladder down into the chimney about 50 feet and became stuck at the bottom.
The man, who reportedly was 53, was working to upgrade Yale's Central Power Plant at about 10 a.m. when he fell, according to New Haven Assistant Fire Chief Matthew Marcarelli. The man was a subcontractor, Yale spokeswoman Karen Peart said.
The man's name was not immediately released, but fire officials said he was from Oregon and was a longtime worker for a company doing the work for the university, the Hartford Courant reported.
Marcarelli said the man was stuck for an hour while crews worked to open the side of the chimney. They had to cut through a stainless steel liner to get him.
